A Non_conductive_cross_section_template is a type of .
the nominal_width specifies a for the Non_conductive_cross_section_template.

the template_technology specifies a for the Non_conductive_cross_section_template. There shall be one or more for a template_technology. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Printed_connector_template is a type of a . A Printed_connector_template is a that contains contacts, each of whose function is to act as a short from an interface_terminal of a to the related join_terminal of the . Each contact corresponds to one member of characterized_connector_terminal_relationship. The contact shall be a and the geometric relationship of the shape of the contact to the shape of the Printed_connector_template shall be established by a member of Usage_view_usage_relationship.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates a template and associated parameters for one contact of a printed connector. Specific parameter values and explicit geometry will be provided for individual technology based contacts.
Figure illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows an instance of the Printed_connector_template.
ext_description.note: It is redundant to have a separate functional definition that merely specifies shorts for any type of connector in this part of ISO 10303, because the functional definition of a short is included in the definition of the connector. That is, a functional definition that worries about shorts is not a functional definition. It is appropriate to define the location of required shorts in the physical definition, and connector is one of the places in this part of ISO 10303 where that occurs.

There may be multiple simulation models associated with a connector in this part of ISO 10303. The explicit method of defining the connector functionality does not prohibit having multiple simulation models. This explicit method is for the purpose of supporting the standardized structural definition of connectivity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the characterized_connector_terminal_relationship is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_connector_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_connector_template as its . There shall be one or more for a Printed_connector_template.

ext_description.p: A Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is the definition of the connection between a and a for one contact of a .
ext_description.note: An occurrence of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is only required at the model level in the Standard. A that references a has the visibility of this functional requirement by virtue of a mandatory inverse relationship to the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship on the .
A Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship is the actual specification of the short referred to in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the connector specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
the interface_terminal specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
the join_terminal specifies the role of the for the Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationship.
The combination of the join_terminal and the connector shall be unique within a population of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationships.
The combination of the interface_terminal and the connector shall be unique within a population of Printed_connector_template_terminal_relationships.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Printed_part_cross_section_template is a type of that describes a cross sectional view of a .
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates parameters, cross-sectional geometry, and materials needed to describe different transmission lines and related media.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the minimum_width specifies the minimum overall lateral dimension through all the material of the Printed_part_cross_section_template.
the maximum_width specifies the maximum overall lateral dimension through all the material of the Printed_part_cross_section_template.
the transmission_line_model specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template. The transmission_line_model is optional and need not be supplied.
There shall be more than one terminal provided for a Printed_part_cross_section_template.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal is a type of that is the terminal of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the cross_section_definition specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_cross_section_template_terminal.

ext_description.p: a Printed_part_template is a type of . Each Printed_part_template may be either one of or both of a or a . a Printed_part_template is a that has a specified function. Material may be discontiguous in a Printed_part_template.
ext_description.note: An occurrence of this object is a that is realized during the manufacturing process for the printed circuit board.
The functionality realized in an occurrence of a Printed part is determined by the shape of the occurrence and the material constituting the occurrence.
ext_description.example: Figure illustrates shape data associated with single layer Printed_part. This part of ISO 10303 supports complex, specific purpose, multi-layer Printed_part exchange using the design reuse concept with the being a design view that contains the full multi-layer definition of the part design. Individual elements of the part design on a layer basis would be related to individual elements in the design being created using the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the raw_access_mechanisms specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The raw_access_mechanisms may be an empty set for a particular Printed_part_template. The raw_access_mechanisms provide direct access to the member of Printed_part_template without the need to traverse sub templates of the template.

the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_part_template as its associated_definition. There shall be two or more for a Printed_part_template.
the implemented_function specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The is optional and need not be supplied.

the printed_part_template_stack specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The printed_part_template_stack specifies a vertical sequence of Printed_part_template. The members of the sequence may themselves contain terminals.

the material_stack specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template. The material_stack is a simple vertical structure where the complexity of the printed_part_template_stack is unwarranted. The material_stack need not be specified for a particular Printed_part_template.

ext_description.p: the of_stratum_technology specifies the role of for the Printed_part_template. The intent of having more than one available is that the same template may be used for various technologies.
ext_description.note: The set of technologies has nothing to do with vertical stackup.
ext_description.example: The same template might support varying copper thickness, each variation requiring a specific , since thickness is a key characteristic of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: No more than one of of_stratum_technology, material_stack, printed_part_template_stack, footprint_implementation shall exist for a member of Printed_part_template.
The category associated with a member of Printed_part_template shall be 'printed part' unless the Printed_part_template is a .
No more than one shall reference a member of Printed_part_template.
A Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition is the association between two or more that are connected.
the name identifies the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition.

the connected_terminals specify the for the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition. There shall be two or more
for the Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definition.
The name shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_connected_terminals_definitions.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_interface_terminal is a type of , an occurrence of which is an external access to the printed circuit board of which it is a component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the external_connector_function is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printed_part_template_interface_terminal as its . There shall be one or more for a Printed_part_template_interface_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_join_terminal is a type of an occurrence of which provides access to the functionality of the from within a printed circuit board.
ext_description.note: Join is a concept that explicitly states the purpose is for completing the network connections internal to a physical design.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the internal_connector_function is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printer_part_template_join_terminal as its join_terminal. There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_join_terminal.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_link is a type of .

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.p: A Printed_part_template_material is the characterized in , for the realization of the containing part of the during fabrication of the .
ext_description.note: A may span more than one , as defined by the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the required_material specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_material.
the minimum_width specifies the minimum for the width of the Printed_part_template_material.
the maximum_width specifies the maximum for the width of the Printed_part_template_material.

ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the subsequent_material specifies a for the Printed_part_template_material_link.
the precedent_material specifies a for the Printed_part_template_material_link.
The precedent_material shall not be the subsequent_material within a population of Printed_part_template_material_link.
The name attribute inherited from for the precedent_material shall be one of "bottom" or "right" within a population of .
The name attribute inherited from for the subsequent_material shall be one "top" or "left" within a population of .
The combination of precedent_material and subsequent_material shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_material_link.
A Printed_part_template_terminal is a type of . A Printed_part_template_terminal is a or additionally one of a or a . A Printed_part_template_terminal is a terminal of a .
the feature_shape specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal. There shall be one or more Feature_shape_occurrence for the Printed_part_template_terminal.

the functional_usage_view_terminal is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Printed_part_template_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_terminal.

the connection_requirement is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Printed_part_template_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Printed_part_template_terminal as its . There shall be no more than one for a Printed_part_template_terminal.
the element_name inherited from identifies the descriptive label for the Printed_part_template_terminal.

the terminal_connection_zone specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal. There may be one or more for a Printed_part_template_terminal. The terminal_connection_zone is optional and need not be supplied if the source system does not contain the data. If the source system contains the data, then the terminal_connection_zone shall be provided.
the connection_zone_category specifies either an area_edge_segment, a curve_edge_segment, a surface_area, or a surface_point for the Printed_part_template_terminal.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Printed_part_template_terminal.
The combination of the name inherited from and the associated_definition shall be unique within a population of Printed_part_template_terminals.

ext_description.p: A Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template terminal_assignment is the association between a functional terminal definition and a terminal of a .
ext_description.example: It is permissible for one functional_usage_view_terminal to be assigned to more than one physical_usage_view_terminal, for example, VCC.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the functional_usage_view_terminal specifies the role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
the physical_usage_view_terminal specifies the role of the for the Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
The combination of functional_usage_view_terminal and physical_usage_view_terminal shall be unique within a population of Functional_usage_view_to_printed_part_template_terminal_assignment.
A Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship is an association between two in a .
the relating_printed_part_terminal specifies the independent in the Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship.
the related_printed_part_terminal specifies the dependent in the Printed_part_template_terminal_relationship.
A Template_material_cross_section_boundary is a type of .
the associated_definition specifies a for the Template_material_cross_section_boundary.
The name attribute inherited from shall be one of "top", "bottom", "left", or "right" within a population of Template_material_cross_section_boundary.
The combination of associated_definition and the name attribute inherited from shall be unique within a population of Template_material_cross_section_boundary.
